key_points: Law enforcement in Portland declared a riot as around 200 demonstrators protested Kyle Rittenhouse's acquittal.
Protesters in Portland broke windows, threw objects at police, and talked about burning down a government building.
Several people were given citations in Portland, and one person was arrested on an outstanding warrant.
Kyle Rittenhouse was acquitted of killing two people and injuring another during a Wisconsin protest against police brutality.
Protests over the Rittenhouse verdict occurred in several U.S. cities including New York, Los Angeles, and Chicago.
In Chicago, around 1,000 people marched in a protest organized by Black Lives Matter Chicago and other groups.
Tanya Watkins, executive director of Southsiders Organized for Unity and Liberation, expressed disappointment and rage at the verdict.
Dozens protested in North Carolina near the state Capitol, accompanied by police officers on motorcycles.
Portland Police Bureau Chief Chuck Lovell stated officers were prepared for the protests following the Rittenhouse verdict.
Some demonstrators in Portland threw urine, water bottles, and batteries at deputies.
spokespersons: Tanya Watkins (Executive Director, Southsiders Organized for Unity and Liberation)
